title: Pantheon's Passive effective?  I have a question for you Riot.
body:
So I had a match against {{champion:86}} and {{champion:17}} recently as {{champion:80}} and I noticed something.  Even though Pantheon's passive will block the attack, he still falls under the effect of {{champion:86}}'s Q and silence (which kinda screws Pantheon over what with him being an AD caster) and {{champion:17}}'s blinding dart.  

This is by no means a QQ thread, but I was just wondering if it is intended for Pantheon's passive to not block the after effects of basic attack abilities.  And if so, why?  While arguing logic doesn't hold much ground in games, shouldn't Pantheon's passive block the entirety of basic attack abilities?  

Just a thought.  What do you all think?  Please share.

Edit: Disregard everything I say about Teemo in this post.  I got an answer to it and I don't want to delete it because that'd make the answering post irrelevant.

replies.body: Yeah, Pantheon's block's somewhat inconsistent with regards to what effects attached to basic attacks it does and doesn't stop. Dodge (Jax) and Blinds have the same issue, the result of a lot of one off calls being made during the development of individual champions as to what should and shouldn't pierce those effects. That's something we planning on standardizing, get a consistent set of rules going (e.g. constant on hit effects like red buff/Teemo poison shouldn't pierce, splash effects like Kayle E/Jinx rockets should miss the primary targets but splash to other nearby enemies etc). Timeline on that's not certain, at a rough guess preseason or around then's most likely though.

Could you answer my question please?
I played Pantheon just now. Destroyed my lane opponent, was 7/1 and well farmed. My enemy was GP.
So then late game came, and I became completely useless. My damage became very pathetic, I couldn't catch anyone, or escape. Just jump in and die instantly. And if that's not enough, my ult was good only to jump onto minions to clear them. Because everyone would escape the ult range before I hit the ground. Every. Single. Time.
My question is: what good is Pantheon's ult? It does 1k magic damage at the center and 500 at the edges. Casting ult takes 7seconds (start- land) so you can't really use it for anything other than getting somewhere quicker.
My suggestion is: either lower casting time at least in half, or cut the damage to champions (not minions) and remove the warning circle on land.

Thank you for your time. I know you're busy, and I appreciate you reading my post.

> Black cleaver isn't good in this situation, as only gangplank had armor, and LW is enough.

> TF costs alot, and is better built early than late.

Nah. TF is a great last item. The only onesbuilding it early is the ones that has it as their core item, like Irelia and Corki. People go Trinity Force on Rengar as their last item, i.e.

> Plate is a good item. Only chasing tool Pantheon has is 1sec stun. Slow and speedup helps alot. It's even better with Ashe having perma slow.

Misconception here. No, it won't help you against Ashe? Why, you ask? Because _slows_, whch we all know Ashe has a lot of, takes away your stacks. No stacks means no MS, nor no slow. You'd be better off getting Swiftness and Randuins.

Some champions scale better than others into late game; other champions are stronger early game. Pantheon has a power spike early on, and it looks like you steamrolled because of it. Next step is using your 7/1 to snowball your team. Your ult isn't used for damage, it's used to transport yourself. Try positioning it along enemy escape routes. You can set up ganks that are almost guaranteed kills whenever your ult is off cooldown and even engage teamfights this way. It takes practice but Pantheon is a fine champion (albeit GP is a little OP so maybe not compared to him).

exactly  u cannot use it to jump directly into a fight they will all just move away what i like to do is use it to move to a flanking position  then jump in with ur stun  or u can ulti in behind the enemy cutting off their escape route both tech of ulti this way are much more effective than trying to ulti into the middle of a fight

Despite the numbers, Pantheon's ult is not the best for dealing damage.  My advice for you is to set up your ult behind your opponent (where they are expected to retreat) so that way you can hit them while they run or take them from behind.  You're going to be too squishy to do this to an enemy team without back up, so save it for teamfight initiations.  

And use W on your targeted enemy as soon as you can.  It's a great combo.
That's why I suggested cutting the damage to champions, and lowering casting time. Because you can't use it for anything, but teleporting.

_Never underestimate the power of map mobility._

But I can see where your logic is.  Personally I wish it was global like it was on release, but it's something you tend to work around.  My only complaint is that it takes long to land, but I think Riot would address that if they ever reworked Pantheon.  Based on most of my games, I don't have a problem with him.  Even in late game (course I play normals).

Might you consider going over targeted self-displacement abilities as well? (abilities similar to Jax's leap strike and Pantheon's stun) There is some inconsistency as to the reliability of the effects (damage, cc, etc.) if the character is interrupted mid-ability.

And maybe two or three more.

If pantheon's passive was more controllable with a better defined cooldown you could make a better argument for it blocking all AA delivered strikes.

Passive hits like: {{champion:32}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:61}} should be stopped from having their secondary effects happening (you don't get a silver bolt tick because you didn't hit with it). That champion exhausts nothing but the AA for gaining that effect.

Active hits (have to spend a CD for) or hits that require a build up of resources like {{champion:57}} {{champion:38}}  {{champion:5}} {{champion:62}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:64}} should not stopped from having the secondary effect (hp restore, mp restore, rend, knockup, silence, energy restore) since they spent resources for that hit. I'm more ok about blocking the damage, since you can do an AA reset to get rid of the shield since it's on the user's interaction more than on panth's successful usage of his passive.

There are some problem champions like {{champion:78}} who has no added utility to her Q strike, but overall I think that it would just be an unfavourable matchup (which is ok honestly, and because you can still do the AA reset).

Whenever Yi does alpha strike and I'm mid W I miss him and the cooldown activates.  I honestly don't see the problem in some champs empowered auto attack abilities being passively blocked and stuck on cooldown afterwards. If anything it could make people time attacks better.
Teemo's blinding dart is not an auto-attack modifier, and thus block wouldn't interact with it at all - though I'll agree you probably shouldn't get silenced when Garen Q's your block.
